Package spring.caches.backend

Class CacheBackend

java.lang.Object
spring.caches.backend.CacheBackend
public abstract class CacheBackend extends Object
Interface for all cache backends.

    • injectCacheMeterBinderProvider

      public abstract void injectCacheMeterBinderProvider​(BiConsumer<String,​Object> consumer)
      Method for injecting instances of org.springframework.boot.actuate.metrics.cache.CacheMeterBinderProvider into a BiConsumer<String,Object>.

      Essential Implementation Restrictions

      Any implementation of this method MUST follow the rules listed below to ensure the correct initialization of a cache backend:

      1. Implementations MUST NOT use a BiConsumer<String, org.springframework.boot.actuate.metrics.cache.CacheMeterBinderProvider<?>.
      2. The first parameter passed to the BiConsumer MUST be the name of the cache provider's implementation of BackendFactory

      Note that it is an intentional design decision to use a BiConsumer<String,Object> and to shift the responsibility of providing a type correct implementation to the caching provider. This way we avoid creating a direct dependency to Spring Boot Actuator in the backend. This is needed as users of Spring Caches may choose to not use Spring Boot Actuator in conjunction with Spring Caches.

      The implementor of a CacheBackend is expected to override this method in order to support Spring Boot Actuator Caching Metrics.

    • injectCacheManager

      public void injectCacheManager​(BiConsumer<String,​org.springframework.cache.CacheManager> consumer)
